name: 尹秦清　教師諮商時間(Office Hours)
objective:
This course introduces the basic concepts, current development and practical operation of e-commerce from the perspectives of business and technology. Through case discussion, this course will discuss the implementation and management of e-commerce, such as website design, internet marketing, social networking sites, and business practice. This course will enhance the abilities of the students in e-commerce research and practical operation. The course content includes: 
1. Introduction of e-commerce
2. Internet marketing business model and strategy
3. Internet marketing website design and online business operation
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction of E-commerce
Week 2: Business Model of E-commerce
Week 3: Infrastructure of E-commerce
Week 4: Internet and Mobile Platform 
Week 5: Holiday for National Day (Double Ten Day)
Week 6: Internet Consumer Behavior 
Week 7: Customer Relationship
Week 8: Online Retail and Services 
Week 9: Midterm Exam
Week 10: Mobile Commerce and Internet Marketing I
Week 11: Mobile Commerce and Internet Marketing II
Week 12: Internet Marketing Mix: Product
Week 13: Internet Marketing Mix: Pricing
Week 14: Internet Marketing Mix: Channel
Week 15: Internet Marketing Mix: Promotion
Week 16: Application of Personal E-commerce I
Week 17: Application of Personal E-commerce II
Week 18: Final Report (PPT presentation)
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance & Class Participation: 20% 
2. Case Study Presentation: 20%
3. Midterm Exam: 30%
4. Final Report: 30%
materials:
1. Laudon, K. C. & Traver, C. G. E-Commerce 2021-2022: Business, Technology, Society, 17th Edition (2021). Pearson press.
2. Turban, E., King, D., Lee, J.K., Liang, T. P., & Turban, D.C. (2012). Electronic Commerce: A Managerial and Social Networks Perspective. 8th Edition. Pearson/Prentice Hall.
